title: Hurricane Melissa live: Jamaica braces amid ‘catastrophic’ threat as category 5 storm approaches
summary: A powerful hurricane, projected to make landfall on the island by Tuesday morning, is being described as the strongest storm since record-keeping began in the 1850s. Authorities are preparing for significant impacts and urging residents to take precautions. The storm's unprecedented intensity raises concerns about potential devastation.

title: NSW Labor ignores own drugs summit advice by keeping sniffer dogs and strip-searches at festivals
summary: Police Minister Yasmin Catley emphasized that high-visibility policing tactics are crucial investigative tools, even at music festivals that trial pill testing. She asserts the need for both safety measures and effective law enforcement. The comments highlight the balance between harm reduction and maintaining public safety at events.

title: First instalment of Australia’s $2.5bn deal with Nauru triggered as first man arrives on island
summary: A deal between the federal government and Nauru is anticipated to last 30 years, affecting approximately two dozen individuals released in connection with the High Court's NZYQ ruling. This agreement aims to address the status of those impacted by the ruling. The specifics of the deal have not been fully disclosed.

title: Socceroos fans divided over new FA+ paid membership offering fast access to World Cup tickets
summary: The membership fee of $99 does not ensure ticket availability for the North American tournament, as ticket allocations vary. Members may still face uncertainty in securing tickets. Therefore, paying the fee does not guarantee access to the event.
